page.title: 03Royston Cave.
page.content: Royston cave was discovered by accident in 1742 by workmen. After a steep descent into the cave there is a bell-shaped room carved out of chalk. Historians think that the cave is man-made. The height is about 10 metres from the floor to the top. There are carvings in the chalk sides of saints, crucifixes and other historical things. It is unique in Europe, but experts tell us that similar caves have been found in Israel. The main theory is that the cave was used by the Knights Templar. These were a religious order of monks who were crusaders. Our class thought that perhaps cavemen built the cave and did some carvings; or perhaps it was used as a prison or by smugglers. The cave is open for people to visit on certain days and is very interesting.
